9b06fb4d-c9c1-4c2c-976e-ce6369ab6adb.description: The Certified Relocation Professional is a highly regarded competency-based designation program for all mobility professionals engaged in corporate/employee mobility within the United States. Recipients are recognized for demonstrating a comprehensive knowledge of the principles and practices of U.S. employee relocation across all facets of the industry, and for their dedication to continuing education in this specialized field.
9b06fb4d-c9c1-4c2c-976e-ce6369ab6adb.name: Certified Relocation Professional (CRP)

badge_template_activities.title: Eligible candidates earn the CRP designation by passing a multiple-choice exam that covers the entire relocation industry, including policy development and administration, home sale programs, U.S. tax and legal compliance issues, relocation appraising and trends in relocation.

81ea22c4-3705-4258-ba7a-e2eb35567eb0.description: The Global Mobility Specialist program was developed for mobility professionals engaged in corporate/employee international mobility, and is open to all sectors of the industry including corporate/HR and relocation service providers. It serves all who wish to differentiate themselves as industry leaders and creates a shared understanding of the field of global talent mobility.
81ea22c4-3705-4258-ba7a-e2eb35567eb0.name: Global Mobility Specialist (GMS)

badge_template_activities.title: GMS candidates must complete three online education modules. Upon completion of the three modules, GMS candidates must take and pass a comprehensive online examination on the principles and practices of global workforce mobility and intercultural management skills based on the materials encompassed across the three modules.

f1ff7c5e-c620-411b-a638-3ec852461bd6.description: The GMS-T designation was developed for mobility professionals engaged in corporate/employee international mobility. Candidates complete 6 online educational modules and comprehensive assessments. Upon completion of the modules, GMS-T candidates must pass a timed comprehensive online examination on the principles and practices of overall global workforce mobility, intercultural skills, and strategic talent management practices based on the materials encompassed across the six modules.
f1ff7c5e-c620-411b-a638-3ec852461bd6.name: GMS-T

4e9f2843-c37d-4dae-a82a-4d73b8c396d7.description: Earners recognize the characteristics of a culturally competent and diverse talent pool. Earners can explain definitions and theories of culture, understand generalizations and stereotypes, discuss importance of global teams, and are aware of the the impact of globalization, as well as the importance of diversity and inclusion. This badge is one of six that are required to earn Worldwide ERC's Global Mobility Specialist, Talent Management (GMS-T) certification.
4e9f2843-c37d-4dae-a82a-4d73b8c396d7.name: Culture & Diversity in Global Mobility

4082a1bf-4753-493d-8be6-16433bd9cf5a.description: Earners recognize the importance of compensation considerations. Discusses the process of localizing an existing expatriate assignee and how companies send employees on permanent moves and a variety of assignments using a local approach. Health care and retirement are also discussed to help the earner understand how to best support employees on assignment. This badge is 1 of 6 required to earn Worldwide ERC's Global Mobility Specialist, Talent Management (GMS-T) certification.
4082a1bf-4753-493d-8be6-16433bd9cf5a.name: Compensation & Benefits for a Global Workforce

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must take online course, Compensation Considerations for a Global Workforce.  Compensation is an important tool for companies as they seek to attract, develop and retain talent in today’s environment where employers are competing for skilled talent. This course discusses the considerations to compensation for employees being sent on intl assignment and their advantages and disadvantages.

Earner must take online course, Localization and Local-Plus in International Mobility.  The traditional long-term expatriate assignment generally includes a suite of financial and logistical assistance that can be expensive. Cost management is always an imperative for talent mobility programs, and one alternative to the traditional assignment is localization. This course discusses the process of localizing an existing expatriate assignee.

Earner must take Health Care Strategies for a Global Workforce. As you seek to help employees make their transition, this course is helpful to understand how they will receive and pay for necessary medical treatment while they are traveling or on assignment.  The choices employers make about how they will help mobile employees with health care insurance are influenced by many factors.  This course will help you understand those factors and why employers make these decisions.

Earner must take Retirement Planning for a Global Workforce. As a mobility professional, you will be working with employees whose retirement planning has become complex. It is helpful to understand the types of retirement plans employees may be enrolled in as you assist them in transitioning to a new location.  This course provides an overview of retirement plans, their history and factors and options that employers consider in providing retirement benefits to internationally mobile employees.
Earners must pass a comprehensive assessment.

a60e3df1-3e3c-49b5-a8be-6679a4c65981.description: Earners learn the importance of a well-coordinated support plan. Discusses significance of assisting the employee and their family with the moving-out logistics and providing guidance necessary for a successful relocation. Covers the necessity for support during and post-assignment in addition to alt. talent mobility options to the typical one to three years’ assignment. This badge is one of six required to earn Worldwide ERC's Global Mobility Specialist, Talent Management (GMS-T) certification.
a60e3df1-3e3c-49b5-a8be-6679a4c65981.name: Global Talent Mobility Policy Management

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must complete Successful Short-Term, Rotational, Commuter and Extended Business Travelers course.  This course discusses alternative talent mobility options due to the high costs involved in relocating an entire family.  Using alternative options allows companies to meet business needs that require their assignees to deploy for shorter durations and for different purposes more cost-effectively.

Earner must complete the course, Essentials of Expatriate Assignment Support Policies.  The course covers the various ways a company can support the employee and family before, during and after an international assignment and discusses the importance of each stage.

Earner must complete the course, International Assignments: Pre-Planning.  Course covers the importance of utilizing careful planning and communication when sending an employee on assignment.  As a result, global mobility practitioners can minimize the risk of issues arising by going through a series of per-assignment activities presented in the course.
Earners must pass a comprehensive assessment.

f0715905-2ec2-4219-8f1e-baefd17ea4a5.description: Earners learn that managing supplier relations is a key component of successful employee mobility. They also discover some best practices employers use to make international assignments successful, as well as ways to measure the success of those efforts. Also explored ways to introduce more flexibility into a company’s international assignment policies and admin processes. This badge is 1 of 6 required to earn Worldwide ERC's Global Mobility Specialist, Talent Management (GMS-T) certification.
f0715905-2ec2-4219-8f1e-baefd17ea4a5.name: Global Talent Mobility Program Management

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must complete Fundamentals of Supply Chain Management for Workforce Mobility course.  This course focuses on the Relocation Management Company's responsibilities for managing their supply chain.  The concepts can also be used by an employer with an in-house mobility department.

Earner must complete the course, Assignment Lifecyle Best PracticesIn this course, you will explore ways to introduce more flexibility into a company’s international assignment policies and administrative processes..  This course focuses on some of the best practices employers can use to make international assignments successful, as well as some ways to measure the success of those efforts.

Earner must complete the course, Flexible International Assignment Policy Strategies.  This course explores ways to introduce more flexibility into a company’s international assignment policies and administrative processes.

Earner must complete Secure and Compliant Household Goods Shipping course, which presents current risks and challenges with shipping household goods globally.  Discusses the impacts and consequences of compliance and adherence to international shipping regulations that creates new challenges in preparing employees for international assignment, as well as for companies that provide global mobility services.
Earners must pass a comprehensive assessment.

4d5eb8d0-c2d3-4111-b314-ca78afaf1f36.description: Earners learn the significance of ensuring the employee is looked after and all risks are assessed and mitigated. High level tax and immigration issues are discussed. Also drills down into what duty of care stands for, considerations necessary when developing a policy for mobile employees, and best practices. Candidates also learn the basics of data analytics. This badge is 1 of 6 required to earn Worldwide ERC's Global Mobility Specialist, Talent Management (GMS-T) certification.
4d5eb8d0-c2d3-4111-b314-ca78afaf1f36.name: Global Talent Mobility Risk Mitigation

63656a2d-6766-41a2-9bda-e9276e0595b9.description: Employers recognize that mobility is a critical strategic component of a well-managed talent management program. As a result, earners learn talent mobility in the wider context of talent management. They review real-life case studies illustrating how leading companies have achieved success by integrating their talent mobility practices into their talent management planning. This badge is 1 of 6 required to earn Worldwide ERC's Global Mobility Specialist, Talent Management (GMS-T) certification.
63656a2d-6766-41a2-9bda-e9276e0595b9.name: Strategic Talent Mobility

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete Strategic Talent Mobility: Understanding the Intersection of Talent Management and Global Mobility course. Concepts include: Understanding talent mobility in the wider context of talent management; Learning to identify and respond to the key drivers of talent mobility; Comprehending when and how the organization’s business and talent strategies can be accomplished through talent mobility; Assessing an organization’s talent needs, including parameters for success metrics.
Earners must pass a comprehensive assessment.
